result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DonJuan E Irving

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lakeya S McDonald in court.  Attorney Same Obscherning in court for Lakeya S McDonald.  Attorney David T. Malone in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant needs to complete the firearm safety course and the essay. In order to receive the benefits of the agreement, the defendant needs to complete the terms of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant DonJuan E Irving in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his  right to have an in person hearing and agreed to proceed by Electronic Means.
 Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, 
parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Defendant DonJuan E Irving in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requests to resolve the case through a DPA. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant DonJuan E Irving in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DonJuan E Irving appeared by video means with Attorney.  HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. 
Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 This hearing will be be held in person.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant DonJuan E Irving in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br.19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for DonJuan E Irving
Current: 2434 W Wells Ave #102, Milwaukee, WI 53233   (Effective: 04-07-2022)
Prior: 8869 West Appleton Avenue #10, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/7/22 @ 2p
